reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a total of 4 nights at the Buckrail Lodge. Everyone we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. Everything you need is there - refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker (also coffee in lobby), free wifi, hairdryer, iron, ironing board, ceiling fan, shampoo, soap. Beds were comfortable. Location was very convenient. Just a short walk into town which was great because parking in town was crazy. Far enough away from town that it was very quiet at night. Loved it and will return when we get the chance.
reviews.title: Very Clean & Great Location

reviews.text: Very comfortable and convenient, nice log cabin style outside and in, with small vaulted ceiling with fan. Good size room with 2 queens, well lighted bathroom. Nice park setting outside your door away from the noise of Jackson (about 6 blocks to town square). Computer with printer in the office available for guests in addition to the wifi. Hot tub on site, and free ice as well as a refrigerator in the room. Bathroom has window which is a nice change. Owner very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Western feel and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These quaint log cabin rooms are in a great, quiet location walking distance to the town square. There is a nice local park nearby with a climbing wall that would be lots of fun for kids. The rooms are clean and have a mini fridge and microwave. They are quiet until your neighbor takes a shower or talks and then it's not so quiet. The price was reasonable considering Jackson. We were disappointed that we could not get coffee, tea and hot chocolate the morning we left, as the office was not open even at 7:30 a.m. There is a coffee maker in the room, but if lyou are a tea drinker or would like hot chocolate, don't get up early.
reviews.title: Quiet Location Walking Distance to Town Square
So good, we went back!
reviews.text: We felt right at home at Buckrail Lodge. We first stayed near Yellowstone, since it is a 2-hour drive from Jackson to that park entrance. We then stayed here, having fun in town (walked the 5 blocks - easy) before going into Grand Teton NP for a few days. When we realized how long it would take us to drive from Colter Bay back to Salt Lake City to catch our flight home, we decided to change our final night to the Buckrail Lodge, since we had been so comfortable there. The only reason I didn't give it the excellent rating is that I save it for over-the-top amenities. But what they offer here, they do with excellence and heart. We would definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this place! The log cabin atmosphere was an extra touch. This place was very clean. You could tell that cleaniness was important to owner. Who, by the way, went above and beyond to help us. Felt like your own backyard. Chairs and picnic tables. Walking distance to a park, lift, walking trail, rodeo and town square was about 1/2 mile. So glad we didn't get place off square (nice place to visit, but I wouldn't want to stay that close). Would highly recommend Buckrail Lodge.
reviews.title: So much fun to stay here!

reviews.text: We discovered Buckrail Lodge by reading all of the great reviews on Tripadvisor. Our family absolutely loved this place. The room was spotless and we loved the log walls. The owner was fantastic. It was great to come back to after a day of exploring and relax on the lawn with a beautiful view. We loved that we were within easy walking distance of town square and the rodeo.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: This is a family run string of 12 "log cabin" type rooms just a few blocks from downtown Jackson. The kids (9 and 5) thought the moose lamp shades and "log cabin" type rooms were very cool. You park right in front of your door, and across from the rooms is a yard area with lounging chairs, picnic table, kids toys, very neat indeed.
reviews.title: Coolest Thing Since Sliced Bread

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a 5-10 minute walk to downtown Jackson and the shops, town square (don't miss the daily 6:00pm gunfight in the town square), and everything you need. We stayed for 2 nights and never drove anywhere.
reviews.title: Grat Value and Very Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, and anyone we talked to in the office was extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this property. (They don't have an online reservation system, so you do have to go old school and call them for a reservation).
reviews.title: Reasonable for Jackson

reviews.text: This is a family run buisness just a couple of blocks from the town square.The staff went out of there way to make sure we had all we needed and more.The accomodation was spotless and large enough for all to move round without getting in each others way.the price when you see what other places in Jackson are charging was very reasonable,there was even a computer provided for me to email back to the UK to let everyone know all was well.Many thanks we would not hesitate in recomending you to others.Get the staff to direct you to the Gun Barrel the fillet stake there was the best I have ever had.
reviews.title: Great Find in Jackson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second time staying at the Buckrail Lodge and once again I was pleased with everything. It's an amazing value for Jackson. Cute log rooms, comfy bed, and handy mini-fridge and microwave. The location is just far enough from the town square to get a quiet night's sleep, but close enough to walk to everything. I hesitate to praise it too much or everyone will know about it!
reviews.title: A Great Value & More!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small and friendly lodge is situated near the heart of Jackson and is a delightful lodge well maintained and fully fitted. There is a free internet service in the lobby which is a boon if you've just arrived from Yellowstone. The service is excellent and very friendly. There is a hot tub but it was too hot outside for us to use.
reviews.title: Small and Friendly

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Delightful!!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Buckrail mid June, 2012.. Was perfect for us! Clean, comfortable and just off the beaten path. Janet was just great. Was kind of like staying at your favorite Aunts house for a few days. Was the best bang for the buck on our trip west. Would highlty recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Just as Good as two years ago!

reviews.text: John and Jean Pratt
reviews.title: Best value in Jackson, WY. Our favorite motel in 2 weeks of traveling.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful little lodge to stay in. The rooms were spacious, ours had 2 queen beds. Room was clean and in excellent shape. Bathroom was big with all the amenities. Very quiet area. We used the hot tub which was an excellent end to the day. It may be time to get new mattresses as we did not sleep very well, although it may have been just us. The owner was very nice and helped us select our restaurant for the evening, Snake River Brewery. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay in Jackson!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel in an ad for Solitude raft trips ( must be connected because "Solitude" vans were at the property). We have been in Jackson maybe 5 or 6 times and didn't know this place existed. You will not find it on the typical travel websites, look up their site and call directly. Word of mouth and return customers must be working for them because they were full. They have 12 rooms and thay were all booked other than one night of our trip so we stayed only one night (We booked on short notice). Area is very quiet, residental and grounds are well kept. The family dog greeted us as we checked in which we enjoyed and made us miss our four legged kids a little more. Room was beautiful and very roomy... 2 beds, desk area, fridge, micro, small table and two chairs, large bathroom. SUPER clean log home type, price was very good also. VERY NICE locally owned and operated place, has character.
reviews.title: Jackson's little secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BF and I were very pleased to have found this logge to stay in for our recent trip to GTNP. It was like staying in your own little log cabin. Rooms were very clean. They were a good size. Owners were pleasant and helpful. Within walking distance to main attractions in Jackson Hole.
reviews.title: Buckrail Lodge is a winner!

reviews.text: Only thing we wish could have been better were the comfort of the beds and a better TV. The beds were just uncomfortable enough that I didn't sleep that well. The TV was a flat screen but the picture was going on it. But we were not there to spend hours watching TV, so it was fine in the end.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Jackson, especially for families

reviews.text: We (my husband, 2 kids and I) stayed here for four nights while visiting Grand Teton and Jackson. While a bit outside of the town centre, the town square area is certainly within walking distance, and the lovely lawn and quiet, green atmosphere were definitely worth the short distance, in our opinion. There is also a nice city park just a block away, and the Snake River Brewery, where we ate twice, is only a few blocks. The owners were very friendly and helpful, and the room was nice, clean, well-appointed and spacious. The kids loved the hot tub as well. If we go back to Jackson I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Your own room in a modern log cabin
